paragraphs.content: Psalm 77
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 77

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of Asaph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of Asaph.

paragraphs.content: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

paragraphs.content: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.

paragraphs.content: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.

paragraphs.content: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

paragraphs.content: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.

paragraphs.content: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?

paragraphs.content: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?

paragraphs.content: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.

paragraphs.content: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the most High.

paragraphs.content: I will remember the works of the LORD: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will remember the works of the Lord: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.

paragraphs.content: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.

paragraphs.content: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God?

paragraphs.content: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

paragraphs.content: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were troubled.

paragraphs.content: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine arrows also went abroad.

paragraphs.content: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.

paragraphs.content: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.

paragraphs.content: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
